00028 namespace ui {
00029 class ICursorItemProviderProxy;
00030   /*
00031    * <summary> * Provider that exposes data from a <seealso cref="gaia.database.Cursor Cursor"/> to a
00032    * <seealso cref="gaia.widget.ListView ListView"/> widget. The Cursor must include
00033    * a column named "_id" or this class will not work. </summary>
00034    */
00035 class ICursorItemProvider : public IListItemProvider {
00036   public:
00037     ICursorItemProvider(core::Context* context, int32_t layoutid, storage::Cursor* c, const base::StringArray& array, const base::Vector<int32_t>& v);
00038 
00039     explicit ICursorItemProvider(ui::ICursorItemProviderProxy* icursorProviderProxy);
00040 
00041     ~ICursorItemProvider();
00042     /*
00043      * <summary> * Returns the cursor. </summary>
00044      * <returns> the cursor. </returns>
00045      */
00046     storage::Cursor* getCursor() const;
00047     /*
00048      * <seealso cref= gaia.widget.ListAdapter#getCount() </seealso>
00049      */
00050     virtual int32_t getCount() const;
00051     /*
00052      * <seealso cref= gaia.widget.ListAdapter#getItemId(int) </seealso>
00053      */
00054     virtual int64_t getItemId(int32_t position) const;
00055     /*
00056      * @brief
00057      * Indicates whether the item ids are stable across changes to the underlying data.
00058      */
00059     virtual bool hasStableIds() const;
00060     /*
00061      * <seealso cref= gaia.widget.ListAdapter#getView(int, View, ViewGroup) </seealso>
00062      */
00063     virtual gaia::core::Widget *getItemWidget(int32_t position,
00064                 gaia::core::Widget* pItemWidget, gaia::core::Widget* pParent);
00065     /*
00066      * <summary> * Change the underlying cursor to a new cursor. If there is an existing cursor it will be
00067      * closed.
00068      * </summary>
00069      * <param name="cursor"> The new cursor to be used </param>
00070      */
00071     void changeCursor(storage::Cursor* cursor);
00082     storage::Cursor* swapCursor(storage::Cursor* cursor);
00083     /*
00084      *<summary> * <p>Converts the cursor into a String. Subclasses should override this
00085      * method to convert their results. The default implementation returns an
00086      * empty String for null values or the default String representation of
00087      * the value.</p>
00088      * </summary>
00089      * <param name="cursor"> the cursor to convert to a String </param>
00090      * <returns> a String representing the value </returns>
00091      */
00092     base::CharSequence* convertToString(storage::Cursor* cursor) const;
00093     /*
00094      * <summary> * Runs a query with the specified constraint. This query is requested
00095      * by the filter attached to this adapter.
00096      *
00097      * The query is provided by a
00098      * <seealso cref="gaia.widget.FilterQueryProvider"/>.
00099      * If no provider is specified, the current cursor is not filtered and returned.
00100      *
00101      * After this method returns the resulting cursor is passed to <seealso cref="#changeCursor(Cursor)"/>
00102      * and the previous cursor is closed.
00103      *
00104      * This method is always executed on a background thread, not on the
00105      * application's main thread (or UI thread.)
00106      *
00107      * Contract: when constraint is null or empty, the original results,
00108      * prior to any filtering, must be returned.
00109      * </summary>
00110      * <param name="constraint"> the constraint with which the query must be filtered
00111      * </param>
00112      * <returns> a Cursor representing the results of the new query
00113      * </returns>
00114      * <seealso cref= #getFilter() </seealso>
00115      * <seealso cref= #getFilterQueryProvider() </seealso>
00116      * <seealso cref= #setFilterQueryProvider(gaia.widget.FilterQueryProvider) </seealso>
00117     */
00118     storage::Cursor* runQueryOnBackgroundThread(const base::CharSequence& constraint) const;
00119     /*
00120      * @brief
00121      * Returns the number of types of Widgets that will be created by getItemWidget(int32_t, gaia::core::Widget *, gaia::core::WidgetController *).
00122      */
00123     virtual int32_t getItemWidgetType(int32_t position) const;
00124     /*
00125      * @brief
00126      * Indicates whether all the items in this adapter are enabled.
00127      */
00128     virtual bool areAllItemsEnabled() const;
00129     /*
00130      * @brief
00131      * Returns true if the item at the specified position is not a separator.
00132      */
00133     virtual bool isEnabled(int32_t position) const;
00134     /*
00135      * @brief
00136      * Returns the number of types of Widgets that will be created by getItemWidget(int32_t, Widget *, WidgetController *).
00137      */
00138     virtual int32_t getWidgetTypeCount() const;
00139     /*
00140      * @brief
00141      * Return true if provider does not contain anything.
00142      */
00143     virtual bool isEmpty() const;
00144     /*
00145      * @brief
00146      * Create a new Widget that will be displayed on screen.
00147      */
00148     virtual gaia::core::Widget *createItemWidget(int32_t position);
00150     ICursorItemProviderProxy* getProxy() const;
00151 
00152   private:
00153     mutable storage::Cursor* mpCursor;
00154     mutable storage::Cursor* mprunQueryCursor;
